defined_terms.Confidential Information: any non-public business, technical, financial, or operational information disclosed by either party in any form
defined_terms.Effective Date: is entered into as of January 15, 2024
defined_terms.Implementation Plan: The implementation plan attached as Schedule B
defined_terms.Service Data: the operational records, usage logs, support tickets, and configuration details generated through Licensee's use of the Software
defined_terms.Software: the hosted workflow orchestration platform described in Schedule A

governing_law.full_clause: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of Delaware.

obligations.text: Licensee shall restrict access to the Software to its employees and contractors who have a need to use the Software for authorized business purposes.
Licensee must maintain current administrative contact information and shall promptly notify Licensor of any unauthorized access, suspected credential compromise, or misuse of the Software.
Licensor shall configure the Software in accordance with the Implementation Plan within thirty (30) days after the Effective Date.
Licensor shall provide remote onboarding sessions, administrator training materials, and standard email support during Licensor's normal business hours.
Licensee agrees to provide timely access to personnel, systems, and information reasonably required for configuration, testing, and deployment.
Licensee will designate a project manager who is authorized to approve milestones, coordinate user acceptance testing, and consolidate implementation feedback.
Licensee shall pay the subscription fees set forth in Schedule C within fifteen (15) days after receipt of an undisputed invoice.
If Licensee disputes any invoice in good faith, Licensee must give Licensor written notice describing the disputed amount and the basis for the dispute before the payment due date.
Licensee must not remove or obscure any proprietary notice embedded in the Software, documentation, or training materials.
Licensor shall process Service Data only for the purpose of providing, maintaining, securing, and improving the Software as permitted by this Agreement.
Licensor must maintain administrative, technical, and physical safeguards designed to protect Service Data against unauthorized access, loss, or disclosure.
Licensee shall remain responsible for the accuracy, quality, and legality of all Service Data submitted to the Software.
Upon termination, Licensee shall cease all use of the Software, and Licensor shall make Service Data available for export for thirty (30) days after the effective date of termination.

termination_conditions: Either party may terminate this Agreement upon thirty (30) days written notice if the other party materially breaches this Agreement and fails to cure that breach within the notice period.
Licensor may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if Licensee intentionally misuses the Software, repeatedly violates the use restrictions, or becomes insolvent.
